info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 2:59PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A moderate to heavy band of snow showers will impact portions of northwestern Lewis and Clark, Pondera, southern Liberty, southeastern Glacier, southern Toole, northern Teton, southwestern Blaine, southern Hill and northern Chouteau Counties through 400 PM MST... At 256 PM MST, satellite and webcams were tracking a band of moderate to heavy snow showers along a line extending from 12 miles northwest of Beaver Creek to 9 miles northwest of Kiowa. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Brief period of moderate to heavy snow and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Satellite and webcams. IMPACT...Visibility down to a quarter mile or less could result in hazardous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Shelby, Conrad, Chester, Big Sandy, Valier, Parker School, Lothair, Joplin, Brady, The Knees, Heart Butte, East Glacier Park Village, Azure, Inverness, Agency, St. Pierre, Kiowa, East Glacier Park, Sangrey and Boneau. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 316 and 365. Highway 2 between mile markers 199 and 219, between mile markers 223 and 225, between mile markers 271 and 354, between mile markers 357 and 358, and between mile markers 362 and 374. Highway 87 between mile markers 48 and 106. Highway 89 between mile markers 48 and 110. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If traveling, be prepared for sudden changes in visibility and road conditions.
